concept.title: IIC Overview
concept.shortdesc: This document gives a brief overview of the Symbian platform IIC API.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The IIC API creates a common interface from Symbian platform to serial inter-IC buses (IIC buses). The interface is implemented on hardware by platform implementers and used by device creators to write applications such as device drivers.
This document is intended to be used by Symbian platform device creators and device driver writers.

section.title: Architectural Relationship
section.p: The IIC API is part of a group of APIs which provide a common interface from Symbian platform kernel to different hardware. Other APIs of this type include GPIO and I2S.

Physically, an IIC bus is accessed over a node. The IIC API wraps a node in a software construct called a channel. It provides functionality for creating and accessing channels directly and also provides a channel controller enabling an application to access multiple channels. Channels are either masters or slaves and the API provides master, slave and master-slave functionality.
